title: George Booth, New Yorker Cartoonist of Sublime Zaniness, Dies at 96
description: He depicted a quirky cast of people and pets — notably his mad-as-a-hatter bull terrier, which became a reader favorite and the magazine’s unofficial mascot.
dc:creator: Robert D. McFadden
media:description: The longtime New Yorker cartoonist George Booth, right, with the magazine’s cartoon editor at the time, Robert Mankoff, in 2001. In a half century at the magazine, Mr. Booth drew roughly a score of covers and hundreds of cartoons for the inside pages.
